title: Unit 9: Things Happen - Comprehensive Test
description: Test de vocabulario y expresiones conversacionales sobre accidentes, lesiones y eventos inesperados

questions.question: What part of your body connects your hand to your arm?
Traduce: 'Me lastimé cuando me caí.'
questions.answer: I hurt myself when I fell

questions.question: I was driving _____ something went wrong.
When someone tells you about an embarrassing accident, you might say:
A sprained ankle is an injury to your foot.
Traduce: 'Derramé café en mi camisa.'
questions.answer: I spilled coffee on my shirt

questions.question: What does 'I wasn't paying attention' mean?
I was working _____ myself when the accident happened.
Traduce: 'Me rompí el brazo jugando fútbol.'
questions.answer: I broke my arm playing soccer

questions.question: Reflexive pronouns like 'myself' and 'yourself' refer back to the subject.
Which body part is between your head and your shoulders?
Traduce: '¿Cómo pasó? ¿Qué estabas haciendo?'
questions.answer: How did it happen? What were you doing?

questions.question: I was so _____! Everyone was looking at me.
When you want to show sympathy for someone's bad experience, you say:
Traduce: 'Eliminé mis archivos de música por accidente.'
questions.answer: I deleted my music files by accident
